intro: Phacelia neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature. Its foliage and flowers are often used in herbal remedies by indigenous communities.
